conversion_verification.notes: Second image is a true 3D cutaway: walls have height/thickness, multiple faces are visible, spaces read volumetrically, and the camera is elevated/angled with the roof removed.

3d_conversion_fundamentals.notes: Strong 3D wall geometry (height/thickness, corners), clear floor-vs-wall separation, angled view, and clean cutaway. Minor simplification/softness at some wall tops and openings reduces perfect structural crispness.

geometric_accuracy.notes: Overall footprint and major zoning match well (garage right, living/dining center-right, alfresco top-right, bedroom cluster top, master suite bottom-left, theatre left-mid, study near entry). Some internal partitions/room boundaries appear simplified, and several openings (doors/windows) are not reliably traceable to the 2D plan.

interior_elements.notes: Major furniture present: beds in bedrooms, sofas/TV in living/theatre-like space, dining tables, kitchen island/counters, bathroom fixtures. A few rooms appear stylized (e.g., theatre/study detail) with simplified fixtures.

visual_clarity.notes: Clean presentation and readable geometry with good lighting. However, windows/door swings are not clearly expressed, making verification of openings harder; some areas look slightly ambiguous due to soft rendering and minimal edge definition.

detected_errors.description: Doors and windows are not consistently or clearly represented, limiting verification of correct wall placement/orientation of openings.
Some internal partition details (e.g., small recesses/closets/WC subdivisions) appear simplified relative to the 2D plan, risking minor layout fidelity loss in service areas.
Furniture is broadly correct but simplified; some room identity cues (e.g., theatre/study specifics) are not as explicit as in the plan.

summary: A true 3D cutaway with strong overall layout fidelity to the 2D plan, but with simplified partitions and insufficiently verifiable door/window placement.
